column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Sm1−xSrxNiO3 (x = 0, 0.2) were successfully synthesized\runder high pressure and high temperature by solid-state reaction method.

#Text=First, the\rprecursors Sm2−2xSr2xNiO4 (x = 0, 0.2) were prepared by calcining stoichiometric\ramounts of Sm2O3 (99.9%, Alfa Aesar), NiO (99.0%, Alfa Aesar) and SrO (99.9%,\rStrem Chemicals) at 1200 ◦C for 24 h.
#Text=Then the precursors Sm2−2xSr2xNiO4, NiO and\rKClO4 (99.0%, Alfa Aesar) were weighed in a molar ratio of 1:1:2, mixed and ground\rthoroughly in an agate mortar.
#Text=Subsequently, the mixture was pressed into pellets and\rsealed in a gold capsule.
#Text=These procedures were carried out in a glove box filled with\rpurified Ar gas (H2O, O2 <0.1 ppm).

#Text=The gold capsule with the mixed compounds was\rthen placed in a BN capsule and heated up to 1000 ◦C and kept at this temperature for\r2 h under the pressure of 2 GPa in a piston-cylinder high pressure apparatus (LPC 250-\r300/50, Max Voggenreiter).
#Text=Then the samples were rapidly cooled to room temperature\rin 1 min followed by the release of pressure.
#Text=The obtained samples were washed with\rdistilled water to dissolve KCl and unreacted KClO4, and then dried.
#Text=The sample Sm0.8Sr0.2NiO2 was obtained by reacting Sm0.8Sr0.2NiO3 with CaH2\r(98.5%, Aladdin) through a soft chemical reduction method.
#Text=Appropriate amounts of\rSm0.8Sr0.2NiO3 and 0.1 g of CaH2 powder were pressed into pellets respectively and then\rsealed in an evacuated quartz tube.
#Text=Note that the Sm0.8Sr0.2NiO3 and CaH2 pellets were\rplaced at different positions in the quartz tube to avoid direct contact.
#Text=The quartz tube\rwas heated to 340 ◦C at a rate of 10 ◦C/min and sustained at this temperature for 10 h.
#Text=We have also tried to reduce SmNiO3 with CaH2 in order to obtain SmNiO2, but failed\rprobably because of the instability of Ni1+ oxidation state [12].
